comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Apparently the Santa Barbara Tea Fire in 2008 started on the grounds at Piranhurst, where there was a famous tea garden. cartas.typepad.com/main/2008/11/santa-barbara-tea-fire---... Recent photo of the Piranhurst Estate gate: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/22166506@N06/5156038871/]

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.sourisseauacademy.org/archon/?p=digitallibrary/digita... is another photo of the open air theater -- which is captioned "from the stage", so may be it's in the opposite direction from this one which says "to outdoor theater stage."

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Here's a photo that matches this one better cdm268001.cdmhost.com/cdm/singleitem/collection/p268001co... with a companion picture in the other direction -- from the stage cdm268001.cdmhost.com/cdm/singleitem/collection/p268001co... And here these photos are, published in Lousise Shelton's Beautiful Gardens of America books.google.com/books?id=yBQwAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA311&l...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: An "urban hiker" provides some history about Piranhurst. www.edhat.com/site/tidbit.cfm?nid=84240 articles.latimes.com/1985-10-20/realestate/re-14391_1_act... shows that actor Gene Hackman sold Piranhurst in 1985. It was bought by Texas billionaire Harold Clark Simmons.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thank you swanq for your excellent research into other images of, and details about this magnificent property.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Here's a good history of the property as well: www.sbphototours.com/data/static/georgelogan/marycel.php According to this, the gardens were heavily damaged in a 1925 earthquake, then rebuilt.
